content:
• Tuesday, September 27, 2016
  • CMCSA

    Harmonic +7.3% on warrant deal with Comcast

    • Shares of Harmonic (HLIT +1.3%) are up 7.3% after hours following a warrant agreement with Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) giving the cable giant the right to buy shares.
    • That right's based on Harmonic's ability to hit specific sales and deployment milestones, the company says -- a "significant validation of our new product investment strategy," says CEO Patrick Harshman.
    • Harmonic will hold a conference call and discuss financial info at 9 a.m. ET tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks firms up international programming

    • AMC Networks (AMCX -2%) has set up its new team to manage international programming.
    • Kristin Jones, senior VP of international programming for AMC, is in charge of managing programming and co-productions for AMC TV and SundanceTV. The company's adding Chris Loveall as VP to help with development and acquisitions.
    • Jones, who help nab shows including The Night Manager and Humans for AMC, will continue to report to programming president Joel Stillerman.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM
  • SEED

    Origin Agritech to sell seed production and distribution business for $60M

    • Agricultural biotech company Origin Agritech (NASDAQ:SEED) +37.3% AH after agreeing to sell its China-based commercial corn seed production and distribution business to Beijing Shihui Agricultural Development for ~$60M.
    • As part of the deal, Origin will receive a royalty stream for the present and future product portfolio and a technology access fee for research and development.
    • Origin says it will retain its corn breeding and biotech R&D capabilities.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • GXP

    Great Plains to launch concurrent stock offerings

    • Great Plains Energy (NYSE:GXP) -1.7%Â AH after announcing concurrent public offerings of 52.6M common shares and 15M depositary shares representing interests in mandatory convertible preferred stock.
    • GXP also grants underwriter options to purchase up to an additional 7.89M common shares and up to an additional 2.25Ml depositary shares.
    • GXP says it plans to use the proceeds from the offerings to help finance its proposed acquisition of Westar Energy.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: SEED +32.2%. COTY +5.8%. PIR +4.6%. CTAS +4.0%. TVIA +3.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: TPX -24.4%. SCSS -9.4%. SONC -6.4%. MT -4.9%. NKE -4.2%.

  • COTY

    Coty set to replace Diamond Offshore in S&P 500; DO -1.3%

    • Coty (COTY +0.3%) is heading to the S&P 500, replacing Diamond Offshore Drilling (DO -0.4%) in that index. Diamond Offshore is off 1.3% after hours, while COTY is up 0.4%.
    • Diamond Offshore will move to the S&P MidCap 400, replacing Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM), which has been acquired by Siris Capital Group. The contract driller was ranked at the bottom of the 500 and now has a market cap more reflective of a mid-cap, S&P Dow Jones Indices says.
    • The moves are effective after the close on Friday.
    • Meanwhile, Tile Shop Holdings (TTS -0.3%) is replacing Epiq Systems (NASDAQ:EPIQ) in the SmallCap 600, as Omers Private Equity is acquiring Epiq in a deal expected to be completed soon.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • ARRY

    Array BioPharma launches $100M equity offering; shares off 4% after hours

    • Array BioPharma (NASDAQ:ARRY) easesÂ 4%Â after hours on robust volume in response to its announcement that it has initiated a $100M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Update: On September 27, the company announced that it increased the size of its equity offering 15% to $115M,Â specifically 18.4M shares of common stock at $6.25.Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 2.76M shares. Closing date is October 3.
    • Net proceeds will fund R&D, the build-out of commercial capability, working capital and general corporate purposes. TheÂ close price on September 27 was $6.59.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 11 Comments
  • GOOG

    Alphabet active after hours on Wedbush Securities downgrade to Underperform

    • AlphabetÂ Class CÂ (GOOG)Â shares areÂ lower by 0.7%Â while Class AÂ (GOOGL) shares areÂ down 0.83%Â on the report.
    • Firm previously retained a Neutral rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 20 Comments
  • SNBR

    Select Comfort stung by Tempur Sealy warning

    • Tempur Sealy isÂ lower by 27%Â after hours following a cut in guidance, and the pain is spreading to Select Comfort (SCSS), which isÂ down 8.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • GALT

    Galectin's GR-MD-02 flunks mid-stage NASH study; shares off 44% after hours

    • Nano cap Galectin Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GALT) slumpsÂ 44%Â after hours on robust volume in response to its announcement that a Phase 2a clinical trial assessing lead product candidate GR-MD-02 for the treatment of patients with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) with advanced fibrosis failed to achieve its primary and secondary endpoints.
    • The primary endpoint of the exploratory single-site, short-treatment duration (four months) randomized study was the mean change in liver fibrosis as measured by a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) test called LiverMultiScan. The study also missed the secondary endpoints measuring liver stiffness as a surrogate for fibrosis as determined by FibroScan and magnetic resonance elastography (MRE). On the plus side, GR-MD-02 was observed to be safe and well tolerated with no serious adverse events reported.
    • Putting a positive spin on the results, principal investigator Stephen Harrison, M.D., says, "Although there was no apparent improvement in the three non-invasive tests for assessment of liver fibrosis in this four-month pilot trial, inhibition of galectin-3 with GR-MD-02 remains promising for treatment of NASH fibrosis. In regard to the potential activity of GR-MD-02, it is encouraging that there is an important clinical effect in moderate-to-severe psoriasis..."
    • The company will host a conference call at 5:30 pm ET to discuss the data.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 8 Comments

  • Oil retraces some losses after inventory decline

    • The API reports an 832K barrel inventory draw vs. expectations for a build. Oil hasÂ added about a quarterÂ on the news to $44.75 per barrel, but remains lower on the dayÂ by 2.5%.
    • USOÂ +0.6%Â after hours
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWTI, UCO, DWTI, SCO, BNO, DBO, DTO, UGA, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, OILX
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 26 Comments

  • Futures orders at Nike miss expectations

    • Nike reports sales rose 10% in FQ1 on a constant currency basis.
    • Revenue by brand (ex-currency): Nike +10% to $8.5B, Converse +4% to $574M.
    • Apparel sales and footwear sales both rose at a double-digit clip on a constant currency comparison, while equipment sales lagged at a 6% rate.
    • Global futures orders +7% ex-currency (+5% reported): North America +1%, Western Europe +9%, Central/Eastern Europe +9%, Greater China +19%, Japan +11%, Emerging Markets +10%.
    • Gross margin -50 bps Y/Y to 45.6% as higher selling prices helped to offset a higher mix of off-price sales and F/X swings.
    • The company ended the quarter with an inventory position up 11% Y/Y.
    • The effective tax rate was 2.5% for the period, a sharp drop from last year's mark of 18.4% due largely to an IRS issue resolution.
    • Previously: Nike beats by $0.17, beats on revenue (Sept. 27)
    • NKEÂ -4.35%Â after hours to $52.96 with the futures orders guidance missing expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 8 Comments
  • FOMX

    Foamix Pharma launches public equity offering; shares ease 5% after hours

    • Foamix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:FOMX) initiates a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced. Shares are downÂ 5%Â after hours on light volume.
    • Update: On September 28, the company announced that it priced 6M shares at $9.50. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 900K shares. Closing date is September 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • FOX

    Clinton-Trump TV presidential debate is most-watched ever

    • Final ratings are still coming together, but last night's presidential debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump will be the most-watched ever.
    • With several networks in, the first presidential debate this season has hit 83.7M viewers, which would surpass the previous most-watched presidential debate, the sole debate between 1980 candidates Jimmy Carter and Ronald Reagan (80M viewers).
    • Of course, that viewer bounty isn't visited on just one network -- more than a dozen televised the event live and (at least during the debate) commercial-free -- but the overall result means a flood of ad dollars going to a variety of networks for pre- and post-debate ads, some of which looked more like the Super Bowl in terms of level of interest.
    • According to Nielsen's current numbers, the Big Four broadcast networks drew 49.1M viewers, up about 25% from 2012; NBC (CMCSA +0.6%) with 18.2M, ABC (DIS -0.3%) with 13.5M, CBS (CBS +1.8%) with 12.1M and Fox (FOX +2%, FOXA +1.7%) with 5.3M. PBS drew 2.9M viewers, while Univision (UVN) added 2.5M and Telemundo 1.8M.
    • On cable, Fox News saw 11.4M viewers, with CNN (TWX +2.3%) slightly behind at 9.8M and MSNBC at 4.9M.
    • Local broadcast chains including Gray Television (GTN -0.1%) and Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +1.5%) have recently cut guidance for political revenues, with advertising spending disappointing.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 104 Comments
  • CTAS

    Cintas beats by $0.18, beats on revenue

    • Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS): FQ1 EPS of $1.26 beats by $0.18.
    • Revenue of $1.29B (+7.5% Y/Y) beats by $10M.
    • Shares +2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • TPX

    Tempur Sealy plunges on profit and revenue warning

    • The company expects full-year adjusted EBITDA of $500M-$525M, down 5% at the midpoint from previous guidance. Net sales are seen as down 1-3% Y/Y.
    • Full results are due on Oct. 27.
    • CEO Scott Thompson: "While our net sales are below expectations, our operational initiatives are going well and are continuing to drive considerable margin expansion."
    • TPXÂ -19.4%Â after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 9 Comments
  • SONC

    Sonic preliminary FQ4 results disappoint

    • "The fourth quarter was below our expectations from both a sales and a profit perspective," says Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC) CEO Cliff Hudson. "The shortfall was largely driven by lower-than-expected traffic, reflecting lower consumer spending in restaurants and continued aggressive competitive activity."
    • Same-store sales are estimated to have fallen about 2%, with a 3% decline at company drive-ins and a 1.8% fall at franchise units.
    • Adjusted net income is seen at $0.43-$0.45 versus consensus $0.48.
    • Full results are due on Oct. 24.
    • SharesÂ -1.75%Â after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • DTE

    DTE Energy remains top pick at Macquarie following deals, higher guidance

    • DTEÂ Energy (DTE -1.5%) remains the top pick among small- and mid-cap regulated utilities at Macquarie, which maintains its Outperform rating and raises its price target by $2 to $107, a day after buying $1.3B in natural gas pipeline assets from M3 Midstream and Vega Energy Partners.
    • Macquarie sees the assets as "attractive strategically given their location, contracts, diversified list of customers, potential for expansion and interconnection with DTE's existing systems," and estimates the deals will add to EPS by $0.04 (+0.8%) in 2017 and $0.15 (+2.3%) by 2020, ahead of DTE's own 2010 guidance of $0.10.
    • DTE raises its 2016 EPS guidance range to $5.09-$5.35 vs. its earlier estimate of $4.91-$5.19, and sees the deal increasing EPS starting in 2017 and adding $0.10 in 2020, according to a slide presentation.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • AMZN

    J.P. Morgan sets $1,000 price target on Amazon, shares +2%

    • FollowingÂ recent $1,000+ target raises at RBC Capital Markets and Evercore ISI.
    • AnalystÂ Doug Anmuth: "We believe Amazon continues to show strong ability to take share of overall eCommerce, and its flexibility in pushing first-party versus third party inventory is a major advantage compared with other retailers." Further: "Our price target is based on a sum-of-the-parts analysis as we believe this methodology appropriately attributes value to the company’s large, fast-growing and surprisingly profitable …Amazon Web Services segment, which Amazon continues to invest in."
    • J.P Morgan previously held an Amazon (AMZN +1.8%) target of $925 (current price $813.68).
    • Overweight rating maintained.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 23 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: OTC:INVT +13%. LIVE +12%. PI +10%. QBAK +10%. TTD +8%.
    • Losers: MSDI -10%. FDS -6%. NEON -6%.

  • CAR

    Car rental stocks slide on European concerns

    • Avis Budget (CAR -7.1%) is sharply lower after some unsettling comments from execs today at the Deutsche Bank's Leveraged Finance Conference.
    • Demand in Europe fell off for Avis due to the combined impact of security concerns, Brexit, the Olympics, and economic factors.
    • Avis conference presentation (webcast)
    • Shares of Hertz Global Holdings (HTZ -8.8%) are faring even worse on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: SAEX +8%. TVIA +7%. TROX +6%.
    • Losers: TANH -13%. VNR -12%. BTG -11%. PQ -9%. ECR -8%.

  • CMG

    Big pop for disinfectant specialist after inking deal with Chipotle

    • Chipotle (CMG -0.2%)Â announces it will use a special antimicrobial disinfectant solution produced byÂ PURE Bioscience (OTC:PURE)Â in all U.S. restaurants.
    • The disinfectant is expected to be productive in preventing notovirus outbreaks and bacteria contamination.
    • The development is doing wonders for the shares of microcap Pure Bioscience.
    • PURE +14.57% to $1.14.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 17 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: YRD +12%. CCCR-OLD +7%. BOFI +6%.
    • Losers: CXW -7%. OTC:FNBC -7%. IRT -6%.

  • VISN

    VisionChina Media back in Nasdaq compliance after filing late form

    • VisionChina Media (NASDAQ:VISN) is up 4.3% today after noting it regained compliance with Nasdaq listing rules.
    • The company last week filed its annual report for the fiscal year ended last Dec. 31.
    • Nasdaq had informed the company it was out of compliance in May for not timely filing the Form 20-F.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: RGSE +94%. GI +89%. DRRX +20%. KTOV +15%. YRD +12%. OTC:INVT +12%. JUNO +11%. CCXI +11%. ACIU +10%. VBLT +10%.
    • Losers: CZR -16%. AOI -14%. TANH -13%. ATNM -13%. BTG -13%. VNR -12%. OTC:GBIM -10%. SPU -10%. LGND -10%. APHB -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 4 Comments
  • GPRO

    GoPro -5% on DJI's Mavic Pro drone unveiling

    • GoPro (GPRO -5%)Â revealed its drone offering, Karma,Â early last week. Competitor DJI (DJI) today exhibits its rival product, Mavic Pro.
    • Mavic Pro is priced at $999 while Karma is priced at $799.
    • With many overlapping features (foldable, mobile control etc.), varying performance, precision, price points and technological capabilities look to be the key factors in determining consumer preference.
    • Shipping for the Mavic Pro begins in mid-October. GoPro's Karma will be available October 23.
    • Live broadcast
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 45 Comments
  • PEGI

    Pattern Energy started at Neutral at UBS

    • Pattern Energy (PEGI -2.1%) is initiated with a Neutral rating and $24 price target at UBS, which sees shares as trading only at a modest premium to its distributable cash flow target of $20 and discount to its yield-based methodology of $28.
    • While shares only trade at a modest premium to DCF value, the firm emphasizes the discount is appropriate as long as PEGI has a separate parent private equity sponsor.
    • UBS also sees greater volatility associated with a largely wind portfolio and financial swaps on some deals.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment

  • Consumer Goods - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: EBF +6%. SORL +6%. IBA +5%.
    • Losers: AOI -15%. SPU -9%. CRI -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • NG

    NovaGold upgraded at J.P. Morgan on strength of Donlin project

    • NovaGold Resources (NG +2.3%) is upgraded to Overweight from Neutral with a C$10.50 price target at J.P. Morgan, which says NG's 50%-owned Donlin gold project in Alaska should get permits next year.
    • The firm thinks NG will be motivated to push ahead with the project as 50% partner Barrick Gold’s ([[ABX] -2.7%) production trends downward; NG has said it has a more than sufficient financial position to cover all project activities and advance the project through completion of permitting.
    • JPM expects companies focused on finding and developing new mines will put the spotlight on NG.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 5 Comments
  • LGND

    Ligand Pharma down 9% on failure of Amgen's Phase 3 Kyprolis study

    • Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND -9.3%) gets some rude treatment by the market in early trading. Shares are down on more than double normal volume in apparent response to the failure of Amgen's (AMGN -1.1%) Phase 3 study of a combination regimen including KYPROLIS (carfilzomib) for the treatment of certain multiple myeloma patients.
    • Investors may be a bit premature on their perception that sales of KYPROLIS will be hampered by the negative results considering the company's statement that the standard-of-care for newly diagnosed multiple myeloma has moved away from the chemo agent melphalan, which was a component of the combo regimens investigated in the study. The long-term trial commenced in March 2013.
    • Ligand receives sales-based royalties from 1.5 - 3.0% from KYPROLIS. In the most recent four quarters, Amgen booked $611M in sales for the drug which translated to a 2.5% royalty for Ligand or ~$15.3M, almost 21% of the company's revenues over the same time frame.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • FDS

    FactSet -5.3% as it misses in Q4, guides below consensus

    • FactSet (NYSE:FDS) is off 5.3% after wrapping up its fiscal year with a miss on top and bottom lines and light guidance for the upcoming quarter.
    • Revenues rose 9.7% and net income grew 8.5%. The company had taken an after-tax gain of $81.7M on the sale of its Market Metrics business in July.
    • Annual subscription value (a view into forward-looking revenues for 12 months) grew 8.8% organically, to $1.15B. Buy-side growth rate in ASV was 9%; sell-side was 7.6%. (Buy-side clients account for 82.6% of ASV.)
    • For Q1, the company's guiding to revenues of $286M-$292M (light of consensus for $293.9M) and EPS of $1.62-$1.66 (well off expectations for $1.72).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • THO

    Strong report from Thor lifts RV sector

    • Thor Industries (THO +3.2%) tracks higher after the company blasts past estimates with its FQ4 report.
    • A positive spin on industry demand has shares of other recreational vehicle makers on the move, including Arctic Cat (ACAT +1.9%), Drew Industries(DW +1%), and Polaris Industries (PII +1.4%). Supplier Patrick Industries (PATK +5%) is also higher.
    • "During the fourth quarter, we saw continued year-over-year industry growth in most product categories and were able to capitalize on opportunities to expand our production capacity and output to meet the growing demand for affordably priced travel trailers and motorhomes," noted CEO Bob Martin.
    • Previously: Thor beats by $0.24, beats on revenue (Sept. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • SJM

    J.M. Smucker slips after Credit Suisse capitulates

    • Credit Suisse lowers its rating on J.M. Smucker (SJM -3%) to a Neutral rating after having the food stock set at Outperform.
    • The investment firm says it didn't properly factor in some of the challenges Smucker is facing, including hefty investments in the pet food business.
    • The new price target from CS is $145 from $158.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • CCL

    Cruise line stocks rally after Carnival says Zika is a non-factor

    • There's a positive vibe in the cruise line sector a day after Carnival (CCL +3.8%) reported pleasing numbers yesterday.
    • Carnival execs said Zika was hardly a factor during the earnings call as they noted first-half 2017 bookings are ahead of last year's pace.
    • CCL on Zika: "We’ve seen no material impact from Zika. We didn't get any cancelations or they’re not enough to mention. We didn't see any impact on booking volume or timing or anything."
    • Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings (NCLH +2.4%)Â and Royal Caribbean (RCL +2.5%) are both following their peer higher.
    • Carnival earnings call transcript
    • Previously: Carnival beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Sept. 26)
    • Previously: Shares of Carnival backtrack despite solid guidance (Sept. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • KTOV

    Kitov Pharma's lead product candidate shows bioequivalence to reference drug at a lower dose; NDA on tap for Q4; shares up 24%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Kitov Pharmaceuticals Holdings (KTOV +24.2%) perks up on almost a 4x surge in volume in response to its announcement of successful results in another bioequivalence study supporting lead product candidate KIT-302, this time with a dose of 2.5 mg of amlodipine. The company's previous bioequivalence study, with successful results announced on May 10, was performed with a 10 mg dose.
    • KIT-302Â is a combination drug that treats osteoporosis-related pain (celecoxib, branded asÂ CelebrexÂ by Pfizer) and hypertension (amlodipine besylate, branded asÂ Norvasc). Kitov expects to submit its New Drug Application (NDA) to the FDA by year end via the abbreviated 505(b)(2) pathway. If all goes well, approval could be granted in 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 4 Comments
  • WFT

    SEC fines Weatherford $140M for accounting fraud

    • Weatherford International (WFT -4.6%) says it agrees to pay a $140M fine to settle the previously disclosed SEC investigation over allegedly inflating earnings by using deceptive income tax accounting.
    • Two former WFT top accounting execs allegedly made inappropriate adjustments to fill gaps and meet goals for the company's effective tax rate that was touted to analysts and investors; WFT restated its financial statements three times during 2011-12 to correct the misstatements.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 3 Comments

    • Gainers: GI +89%. KTOV +26%. MRTX +15%. DRRX +14%. CFRX +13%.

    | 11:00 AM | 4 Comments
  • CACQ

    Caesars Acquisition Company pulls back from 52-week high

    • Shares of Caesars Acquisition Company (CACQ -3.7%) are lower after a brisk run-up over the last few day.
    • Investors continue to hedge their bets on Caesars Acquisition depending upon the progress of the reorganization of the bankrupt Caesars operating unit.
    • CACQ is coming down from the 52-week high of $13.00 it carved out yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • STXS

    Stereotaxis nabs $24M in equity financing; shares up 25%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Stereotaxis (STXS +25.4%) is up on increased volume in response to its announcement that it has secured $24M in equity financing via the private placement of convertible stock with a conversion price of $0.65. The company will raise an additional $25.8M if all the accompanying warrants are exercised.
    • The company has also reached agreement with creditor Healthcare Royalty Partners to satisfy its $18.4M outstanding debt with a payment of $13M, a good prudent move since the interest rate was an onerous 16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • CRI

    Carter's heads south after Wells Fargo cut

    • Carter's (CRI -3.9%) falls after Wells Fargo downgrades the retailer to Market Perform from Outperform.
    • Wells made a late call in pulling its bullish outlook on Carter's, with shares already down 13% since early summer.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • NADL

    North Atlantic Drilling says Statoil cancels rig contract

    • North American Drilling (NADL -4.1%) is sharply lower after Statoil (STO -2%) canceled its drilling contract for NADL's West Epsilon jack-up about two months before expiration; Seadrill (SDRL -2.2%), which owns ~70% of NADL, also is lower.
    • NADL says it will receive an $11M lump sum payment because of the early termination.
    • The rig's dayrate is $247K, so the cancellation means ~$14M in lost backlog; NADL's total backlog is now an estimated $370M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 9 Comments
  • LUV

    Airline stocks perk up after favorable macro mix

    • Airline stocks are pushing higher, led by a jump in Southwest Airlines (LUV +3.1%). A mix of macroeconomic factors, including a drop in oil prices and improved consumer confidence readings could be helping to lift sentiment on the drowsy sector.
    • Gainers include American Airlines Group (AAL +2.6%), Hawaiian Holdings (HA +2.3%), Delta Air Lines (DAL +2.2%), and JetBlue Airways (JBLU +2.1%).
    • Related ETF: JETS.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 7 Comments
  • DB

    Deutsche Bank turns higher after DOJ comments

    • Banks could have and can still spare themselves a lot of pain by cooperating early and often, says Bill Baer, the DOJ's number three man.
    • Baer is speaking about the crisis-era mortgage settlements, some of which ran into the tens of billions of dollars. Banks like Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) and RBS have yet to settle, and his message to the lenders seems to be: Submit quickly, and we'll throttle back the fines a bit.
    • Deutsche of late has come under extreme pressure, in part, thanks to rumors the DOJ is seeking $14B to settle. Down another 3% earlier this morning, the stock has turned marginally higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • SSNC

    SS&C Technologies Holdings upgraded to Overweight at Morgan Stanley; +3%

    • Analyst Brian Essex projects organic revenue to grow, margins to increase and cash flow to improve.
    • Moves from Equal Weight rating previously and raises price target from $37 to $39 (current price $32.71).
    • SS&C Technologies Holdings (SSNC +2.9%)Â is tradingÂ up over 23%Â on the last three months andÂ down slightly over 5%Â on the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM

  • Mexican markets say Clinton won debate

    • The Mexican peso has been as good of a gauge as any for tracking the odds of a Trump victory in November. Prior to last night's debate, it had tumbled to an all-time low vs. the dollar alongside Trump's rise in the polls.
    • It's surging this morning though,Â up 1.5%Â against the greenback. The iShares MSCI Mexico ETF (NYSEARCA:EWW) isÂ higher by 1.95%Â in early action.
    • ETFs: EWW, MXF, MXE, UMX, DBMX, SMK, QMEX, HEWW
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 41 Comments
  • CHK

    Two Chesapeake directors, including Icahn rep, resign

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK -5.6%) discloses the resignation of two board members, including a representative of activist investor Carl Icahn, a week after Icahn cut his holdings in the company by more than half to ~4.5%.
    • Vincent Intrieri, who has served as senior managing director of Icahn Capital, had served on CHK's board since 2012, when CHK named four new independent directors, three proposed by then-largest shareholder Southeastern Asset Management and one proposed by Icahn.
    • John Lipinski, the other departing director, had served on CHK's board since 2014.
    • CHK says the resignations were not the result of any disagreement, but offers no further explanation.

  • SMMT

    FDA designates Summit's ezutromid as Rare Pediatric Disease for treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy

    • Summit Therapeutics (SMMT -8.8%)Â announces it has received Rare Pediatric Disease designation from the FDA for Phase 2-stageÂ ezutromidÂ for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophyÂ (DMD). As a utrophin modulator, ezutromid has potential as a disease-modifying treatment for all patients with the fatal muscle wasting disease DMD, regardless of their underlying dystrophin gene mutation.
    • DMD is a progressive muscle wasting disease that affects around 50,000 boys and young men in the developed world. The disease is caused by different genetic faults in the gene that encodes dystrophin, a protein that is essential for the healthy function of all muscles. There is currently no cure for DMD and life expectancy is into the late twenties. Utrophin protein is functionally and structurally similar to dystrophin.
    • The FDA defines ’Rare Pediatric Disease’ as a disease that primarily affects individuals aged from birth to 18 years and affects fewer than 200,000 persons in the US.
    • If ezutromid is approved, Summit will receive Priority Review Voucher that can be used for a different product or it can be sold to another company. They are quite valuable. In 2014, AbbVie bought one from United Therapeutics for $350M.
    • Update: Slingshot Insights has proposed an expert interview on ezutromid's market potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM

  • ATNM

    Actinium initiates mid-stage clinical trial of Actimab-A in patients with AML over age 60; shares rise 5% premarket

    • Actinium Pharmaceuticals (ATNM) initiatesÂ a Phase 2 clinical trial of Actimab-A in patients newly diagnosed with Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) who are over the age of 60. Actimab-A, Actinium's most advanced alpha particle immunotherapy (APIT) program, consists of the CD33-targeting monoclonal antibody, HuM195, and the alpha-emitting radioisotope, Actinium-225.
    • Actinium-225 gives off high-energy alpha particles as it decays which kills cancer cells.
    • The open-label study will enroll 53 patients. The primary endpoint is the complete response rate defined as complete remission or complete remission with incomplete platelet recovery.Â The secondary endpoint is overall survival. Top-line data should be available in H2 2017.
    • Shares are upÂ 5%Â premarket on modest volume.

  • CVM

    FDA places CEL-SCI's Multikine study in head and neck cancer on clinical hold; shares off 13% premarket

    • CEL-SCI Corporation (NYSEMKT:CVM) announces that it has received verbal notice from the FDA that its Multikine (Leukocyte Interleukin Injection) Phase 3 clinical trial in advanced primary head and neck cancer has been placed on clinical hold. The company expects to receive a formal letter within 30 days and will work diligently to address the matter. The specific reasons for the hold are not provided. The study currently has about 926 patients enrolled.
    • A full clinical hold means that no new patients can be recruited into the study and all dosing must cease. Patients currently enrolled can continue to be followed.
    • The primary endpoint of the study is overall survival over a three-year period. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated study completion date is December 2017.
    • CEL-SCI is also developing its pre-clinical L.E.A.P.S. (Ligand Epitope Antigen Presentation System) technology for the potential treatment of pandemic influenza in hospitalized patients and as a potential vaccine for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.
    • Shares are downÂ 13%Â premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM | 27 Comments
